Material used.Description: Transgenic mice were generated with wild-type or mutant LRRK2 alleles.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Structural change in the protein affecting its function
Readout description.Result Description: DA neuron functionality was disrupted, and locomotor activity decreased on day 7.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Structural change in the protein affecting its function
Readout description.Result Description: DA neuron functionality was disrupted, and locomotor activity decreased on day 7.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Structural change in the protein affecting its function
Readout description.Result Description: DA neuron functionality was disrupted, and locomotor activity decreased on day 7.

Biological replicates.Biological replicates: Three biological replicates were performed for each cluster of dopaminergic neurons.

Technical replicates.Technical replicates: Each sample was assayed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 alleles were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Mouse models lacking the LRRK2 gene were used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Validation controls P/LP: Two positive controls for each variant were included.

Validation controls B/LB.Validation controls B/LB: One negative control for each variant was included.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by post-hoc testing for pairwise comparisons

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DA neuron functionality remained intact and locomotor activity was normal in the wild-type model on day 7.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: DA neuron functionality was significantly impaired, and locomotor activity decreased by at least 30% on day 7.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (approved methods for studying LRRK2-related neurodegenerative diseases)
